item.description: 1996 paper by Richard Bartle focused on MMO players quadrant model: x axis is interacting with world vs interacting with players, y axis is acting on things unilaterally vs interacting with things

item.title: Nine Player Segments
item.description: 9 player segments emerged when conducting a clustering analysis of the roughly 500,000 gamers who took the Gamer Motivation Profile survey.

item.title: RPG Primer
item.description: A role-playing game, or RPG, is a game in which players discuss a fictional setting and assume the roles of characters within that setting.

item.title: Timmy, Johnny, and Spike
item.description: Mark Rosewater is an American game designer best known for being the head designer for the collectible card game Magic: The Gathering, a position he’s held since 2003.

item.title: Trans Rights Are Human Rights
item.description: Trans men are men. Trans women are women. Trans nonbinary people are nonbinary. Trans rights are human rights. I am cisgender, but I stand in solidarity with the transgender and intersex people of the world.

item.title: TTRPG Gaming
item.description: These are the notes I’ve collected about tabletop role-playing games. I’m a big fan of reading these books, mostly in digital form, but don’t get to play them nearly as much as I’d like.

item.title: TTRPGs You Can Play For Free
item.description: This is a list of tabletop RPGs that you can download (or read online) and start playing for free. Only games that have the necessary rules for both players and the GM are free.
